item.title: Elixir Development on Windows 10
item.description: You can have a first-rate development environment on a Windows machine.

item.title: Ubuntu GUI on Windows 10
item.description: I got it working by installing x11-apps to get the X subsystem, then running a X listener like XMING or XManager on the Windows10 side. export DISPLAY=:0 (You also can add export DISPLAY=:0 to the last line of your user’s .bashrc file) Then run xclock to verify. https://superuser.com/questions/1075659/open-ubuntu-bashs-gui-applications-on-windows-10
